Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Cranky \Crank"y\ (-?), a. 1. Full of spirit; crank. [1913 Webster]
2. Addicted to crotchets and whims; unreasonable in opinions; crotchety. [Colloq.] [1913 Webster]
3. Unsteady; easy to upset; crank. [1913 Webster]

cranky adj 1: (used of boats) inclined to heel over easily under sail [syn: {crank}, {tender}, {tippy}] 2: easily irritated or annoyed; "an incorrigibly fractious young man"; "not the least nettlesome of his countrymen" [syn: {fractious}, {irritable}, {nettlesome}, {peevish}, {peckish}, {pettish}, {petulant}, {testy}, {tetchy}, {techy}] [also: {crankiest}, {crankier}]
